intro: Noccaea germanii, commonly known as the common rock cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. Noccaea germanii is a perennial herb that is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
